text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.75.34, Exempt Organizations Examination Procedures, Procedures for Disposition of IRC 501(p) Cases
Revised IRM 4.75.34.1 to incorporate service-wide memorandum “Heightened Awareness, Sensitivity and Understanding of Internal Controls”, September 14, 2016.
and Understanding of Internal Controls”, September
) All references to “EO Manager, Examination Programs and Review (EPR)” becomes Manager” (
) All references to Examination Special Support (ESS) are now“EO Closing Unit”, EGC
) All References to “EO Classiﬁcation-Referrals” are now “EO Referrals Group”. (
) Exhibit

): Added the responsibilities of the EO R&A Anti-Terrorism Coordinator.
IRM 4.75.34.5(1): Added the responsibilities of the EO R&A Anti-Terrorism Coordinator.
The February 6, 2017 revision of this manual is superseded.

Agents will consult the K-NET Knowledge Management Network to ensure proper issue development and consistent application of the law.

) These procedures provide information for agents on closing cases involving organizations that received a designation as a terrorist organization as described in Internal Revenue Code Section (IRC)
(p), enacted as part of the Military Family Tax Relief Act of
(P.L.

). The IRS announces the designations in the Internal Revenue Bulletin and they apply to organiza- tions designated as supporting or engaging in terrorist activity or supporting terrorism under the Immigration and Nationality Act, the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, or the United Nations Participation Act of

(p) suspensions, see IRM

) suspends the exemption from tax under IRC Section
(a) respect to any organization described in IRC
) Under IRC
), suspension of an organization’s tax exemption begins the date of the ﬁrst publication of a designation or identiﬁcation with respect the organization, as described above, or the date on which IRC

(p) was enacted, whichever is later. This suspension continues until all designations and identiﬁcations receive a subsequent recision under the law or Executive Order, under which such designation or identiﬁcation was made. (
) Under IRC
), the IRS doesn’t allow any deduction for a contribution to an organization during the entire period the organization’s tax exemption receives a suspension under IRC Section
(p). Example: No charitable contribution is allowed under IRC
(relating to the income tax). (
) An organization with a suspended exempt status under IRC Section
(p) doesn’t ﬁle Form

, Return of Organization Exempt From Income Tax, but required to ﬁle the appropriate federal income tax returns for the taxable periods beginning on the date of the suspension. The organization must continue to ﬁle all other appropriate federal tax returns, including employment tax returns, and may also have to ﬁle federal unemployment tax returns. (

for Disposition of IRC 501(p) Cases 4.75.34
www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/Pages/default.aspx, and is “sus- pended” under IRC 501(p), there are several implications, including:

Contributions to the organization become illegal. Contributions to the organization lose their deductibility. The organization’s assets are frozen. The Federal Bureau of Investigation or other federal agency will seize and hold the organization’s records; and No organization or person may challenge a suspension in any trative or judicial proceeding relating to the federal tax liability of such organization.

• Contributions to the organization lose their deductibility. • The organization’s assets are frozen. • The Federal Bureau of Investigation or other federal agency will and hold the organization’s records; and • No organization or person may challenge a suspension in any trative or judicial proceeding relating to the federal tax liability of organization. (
) When a case is assigned to an agent involving an organization whose tax- exempt status has been suspended under IRC Section
(p) (Status in the EO Business Master File (BMF)), or is suspended under IRC Section
(p) during the audit, the agent will cease all audit actions and notify manager. After consulting with the manager, the agent will: a. Close the case from the group using either Disposal Code (DC)
, Surveyed After Initial Contact; DC
, Survey Before Assignment, or
, Survey After Assignment, depending on the status of the case the group, and b. Place Form
-A, TE/GE Special Handling Notice, on the front of case ﬁle and check the Mandatory Review section, identifying the as a IRC Section
(p) closure. (
) Mandatory Review staff will mail Letter
, IRC Section
(p) Closing Letter, to the taxpayer. (
) The EO R&A Anti-Terrorism Coordinator is responsible for: a. Serving as the EO liaison with IRS-CI. b. Maintaining an archive of all Potential Terrorism Connection (PTCC). (i.e., Form

) c. Extracting the OFAC SDN list from its website into a spreadsheet and distributing the spreadsheet to internal stakeholders. d. Reviewing and evaluating the completed (PTCC) checksheets e. Forwarding these checksheets to: • Manager for review • Originator for further clariﬁcation • IRS-CI for cases identiﬁed with a risk of terrorism (

) The EO Examinations Fraud Suspense Coordinator (FSC) will: a. Determine whether the designated organization has an established Master File or Non-Master ﬁle audit record and notify the EO R&A nated employee if no audit records exist. b. Assist and coordinate with EO R&A to update the BMF to Status
, Terrorist Organizations, and to update the ﬁling requirement and ment codes. c. Monitor and receive a Lexis Alert when an IRC
(p) announcement published in the Internal Revenue Bulletin. d. Alert all EO Exam managers of the announcement via secure e-mail. Internal Revenue Manual

Exempt Organizations Examination (
) An outstanding balance due on the suspended organization’s tax module preclude the EO R&A designated employee from updating the organization BMF status

The EO R&A designated employee will coordinate with the FSC to determine whether the outstanding balance can be abated. The will: a. Determine whether the IRS is in a collection action to satisfy existing balances, or in other investigative action. b. Coordinate with IRS Criminal Investigation Division to determine OFAC will release the organization’s assets to satisfy existing c. Provide assistance to the EO Exam ﬁeld managers in preparing an for the abatement of any tax liability. d. Prepare both a memo authorizing the Service Center to abate tax interest due, and a Form
-A for the Ogden Service Center. e. Forward both the memo and Form
-A to the FSL/ET Area with a copy to the Mandatory Review (MR) Examination Manager for review and approval. (
) The FSL/ET Area Manager will: a. Review and approve the abatement package. b. Discuss the abatement issues with the EO Examinations Director. (

) If the EO Examinations Director concurs with the abatement, the FSL/ET Manager will: a. E-mail Submission Processing Programs Division (SPP) manager of Business Systems Plan in Ogden, to advise him/her that the package will be forthcoming. b. Alert the FSC. (
) Once the tax liability’s abated, the organization’s BMF entity record can be updated to Status
, allowing the EO R&A designated employee to the ﬁling requirements and remove the entity as an exempt organization.
Organizations Examination Procedures

Once the tax liability’s abated, the organization’s BMF entity record can then be updated to Status 98, allowing the EO R&A designated employee to change the ﬁling requirements and remove the entity as an exempt organization.
